name: Deterministic Phase-Quantized Mass Model
description: Determines the discretization integer n in the mass formula from topological invariants to eliminate over-fitting.

hypothesis.H0: The integer n in the mass deviation term n*(2pi/24) is uncorrelated with topological invariants, and any selection of n leads to overfitting (FPR > 5%).
hypothesis.H1: The integer n is uniquely determined by a deterministic rule n = f(Invariants) derived from first principles (e.g., polynomial degrees), improving mass prediction without increasing free parameters.

data_requirements.description: Masses of all 12 particles and topological invariants (Alexander/Jones polynomials, Volume V) for the assigned knots.

physical_constraints.derivation_requirement: FIRST_PRINCIPLES (Deterministic rule for n, no manual selection)
physical_constraints.notes: Step size 2pi/24 is fixed as a resonance constant from SSoT.

test_method: Multiple regression and Monte Carlo permutation test (N=10,000) for FPR evaluation.
